Assume the snprintf function is available.

snprintf is a safer alternative to sprintf as it prevents buffer overflow errors.

snprintf will return the number of characters written to the buffer or -1 if an error occurs. The buffer size should be set to the maximum expected length of the output string. The buffer size should be the buffer size of the buffer passed in the output_str parameter. 

snprintf buffer size must be set to buffer size - 1 to leave room for the null terminator.
